content.processed:
What is the eRouška app for?

The eRouška (meaning eFaceMask) application was created by the “Smart Quarantine” team as one of the tools to get the COVID-19 illness under control and prevent community spread.

How does it work?

The app in your phone anonymously interacts with other devices via Bluetooth. If you are tested positive, you are given a unique code together with the results of your test.

If you enter this code into eRouška, the app can alert those potentially infected about their risky encounter. Having the knowledge that they met someone who is infected, they can be more cautious and protect those in high-risk groups.

I got an SMS, telling me I'm positive

If you received a positive PCR test result, read the detailed instructions. If the potentially infected are separated from others in time, this could prevent many more from contracting the illness.

Please, enter the code into eRouška. This information is entered anonymously. Even one code can prevent dozens of people from getting infected.

questions_answers.question: If I get an alert that I met with someone positive, do I automatically have to go into quarantine?
questions_answers.value: No. But you should act even more responsibly and monitor your health in the span of 14 days from the risky encounter.
